OPTION.TOOLTIP: Display banner and function progress information
OPTION.ODESC: Display progress information and toolset version when executing.
Suppress common compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated, as well as feature specific status.
Suppress all compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated.
Generate interlisted assembly file

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate C source interlisted assembly file
OPTION.ODESC: Generate C source interlisted assembly file
Read additional compile options the specified filename.
Disable linking, overriding -z (if used).
Print out the compiler release revision and exit.
Pre-define a symbol with the id 'NAME', optionally setting it's contents to 'value'.
Set to on to allow reassociation of floating point arithmetic even in cases where the reassociation will result in a slightly different answer.
Generate auxillary user information file.
Show usage information. When followed by another option or a phrase display that option's detailed information, or search for options related to that phrase.
Add the specified dir(ectory) to the #include file search path list.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file
OPTION.ODESC: Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file
Do not generate .clink directives for const global arrays. By default these arrays are placed in a .const subsection and conditionally linked.

Enable power profiling support by inserting NOPs into the frame code. These NOPs can then be instrumented by the power profiling tooling to track power usage of functions. If the power profiling tool is not used, this option will increase the cycle count of each function because of the NOPs. This switch also disables optimizations that cannot be handled by the power-profiler.
After compiling all the source files, perform a link and pass all the options following this option to the linker.
Set to on to allow reassociation of saturating arithmetic even in cases where the reassociation will cause saturation to occur differently.
Compile only; do not assemble

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Print version numbers for each tool
OPTION.ODESC: Print version numbers for each tool
Undefine the symbol with the id 'NAME'.
Enable full symbolic DWARF debugging in the generated object or out file.
Enable full symbolic COFF debugging in the generated object or out file (DEPRECATED).

Adds the necessary debug directives to the object file which are needed by the profiler to allow function level profiling with minimal impact on optimization (if optimization is enabled). Using -g may hinder some optimizations to ensure that debuggability is maintained, while this option will not hinder optimization.
You will still be able to set breakpoints and profile on function-level boundaries, but you will not be able to single-step through code as with full debug ability.
Disable debug and suppress all symbolic debug information from being included in the generated object or out file.
Enable symbolic debug information for program analysis. (default)
Enable support for embedded C++
Enable K & R C compatibility.
Enable relaxed ANSI source parsing mode.
Enable strict ANSI source parsing mode. Any source violating strict ANSI guidelines will generate a parsing error.
Enable C++ exception handling
Output raw listing to .rl file
Output xref listing to .crl file
Enable multibyte character support in the parser.
Ignore the inline keyword while parsing.
Disable intrinsic functions in the parser.
Enable program mode compilation.
Support C++ run-time type information
All template entities are instantiated as needed in the file. The instantiations are given internal (static) linkage.

Generate a dependency list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include all files included in the source file as well as any of the files included. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the dependency list (similar to gcc).

Generate an include list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the include list (similar to gcc).

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate list of pre-defined and user-defined macros
OPTION.ODESC: Generate a list of predefined and user defined macros for the source file into the file <filename>.pp and then exit. Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the macro list (similar to gcc).
Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop.
Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop; maintain source comments in the output.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Continue with compilation after using -pp<X> options.
OPTION.ODESC: This option instructs the compiler to additionally continue compilation of the source file (rather than exiting) after generating a pre-processing .pp output file such as those generated by -ppd (dependencies) -ppi (included files), or -ppm (macros).
Only preprocess the source file(s) and then stop; maintain #line directives in the output..
Treat diagnostic <id> as error
Treat diagnostic <id> as remark
Suppress diagnostic <id>
Treat diagnostic <id> as warning
Emit the diagnostic identifier numbers along with diagnostic messages. These identifiers can be used with options such as -pds to suppress a specific diagnostic.
Issue remarks, which are normally supressed.
Suppress all parser warnings.
Set error limit to <count>
Enable verbose diagnostic information from the parser, including the source line of the error and an indicator of the error position within the line.
Write diagnostics to an .err file instead of the standard output. The file name with be the same as the source file but with an .err extension.
Codegen outputs algebraic assembly

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Align functions to reduce fetch stalls
OPTION.ODESC: Align functions to reduce fetch stalls
Used by shell to explicitly select assembly source language

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assert ARMS status bit initially set
OPTION.ODESC: Assert ARMS status bit initially set

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assert C54CM status bit is set
OPTION.ODESC: Assert C54CM status bit is set

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assert CPL status bit initially set
OPTION.ODESC: Assert CPL status bit initially set

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assert SST status bit is zero
OPTION.ODESC: Assert SST status bit is zero
Assume all BSS is on-chip

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Changes bus conflict errors to warnings
OPTION.ODESC: Changes bus conflict errors to warnings
Activate byte mode (CHAR_BIT==8)
ROM allocatable constants
This option enables the support for GCC extensions

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Place each function in a separate subsection
OPTION.ODESC: Place each function in a separate subsection
Use large memory model
Specify memory model (small/large/huge)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assume no irregular alias or loop behavior
OPTION.ODESC: Assume no irregular alias or loop behavior
No block/local repeats
Do not generate low_byte/high_byte operands

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Don't expand assembly macros when outputting source
OPTION.ODESC: Don't expand assembly macros when outputting source
Remove NOP in delay slots
Optimize for code size
Optimize for speed

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives
OPTION.ODESC: Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives
Port for speed over size

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Max length of instruction sequence to predicate
OPTION.ODESC: Max length of instruction sequence to predicate

Include the source code of the indicated file at the beginning of the compilation. This can be used to establish standard macro definitions, etc. The file name is searched for in the directories on the include search list. The files are processed in the order in which they were specified.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Specify type size to hold results of pointer math
OPTION.ODESC: Specify type size to hold results of pointer math

Specify the device (and optionally the revision) of the target silicon device to generate code optimized for the revision and to work around issues raised by Silicon Advisories for the revision. Can be specified multiple times to support multiple silicon versions. An argument of 'list' will display the list of recognized arguments

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Allow C54x native mnemonic assembly source
OPTION.ODESC: Allow C54x native mnemonic assembly source

OPTION.TOOLTIP: All gotos/calls are encoded as 24-bit offset
OPTION.ODESC: All gotos/calls are encoded as 24-bit offset

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare)
OPTION.ODESC: Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare)
Specify threshold for automatic inlining

Specify assumptions to make about function calls when optimizing.
Level 0 (-op0) indicates that the module has functions that are called from other modules.
Level 1 (-op1) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called by other modules but has global variables that are modified in other modules.
Level 2 (-op2) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called or globals that are modified by other modules.
Level 3 (-op3) indicates that the module has functions that are called by other modules but does not have globals that are modified by other modules.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate optimizer information file at level [0-2]
OPTION.ODESC: Set the optimizer information file level, or disable with 0. Level 1 includes basic information. Level 2 includes detailed information. The file will be created in the assembly directory if a custom asm directory is specified on the command line otherwise it will be created in the object file directory.

Set compiler optimization level.
Level 0 includes register optimizations. Level 1 adds local optimizations. Level 2 further adds global optimizations. Level 3 further adds interprocedure optimizations.
Using -O without arguments defaults to -O2.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate optimized source interlisted assembly file
OPTION.ODESC: Generate optimized source interlisted assembly file

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Remove entry/exit hooks from inlined function bodies
OPTION.ODESC: Remove entry/exit hooks from inlined function bodies
Inline function that are called only once. Will inline these functions even if auto inlining has been turned off (-oi0)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Insert this call at entry to each function
OPTION.ODESC: Insert this call at entry to each function

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Pass caller's name or address to entry hook
OPTION.ODESC: Pass caller's name or address to entry hook

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Insert this call at exit from each function
OPTION.ODESC: Insert this call at exit from each function

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Pass caller's name or address to exit hook
OPTION.ODESC: Pass caller's name or address to exit hook
Generate code-coverage from profile feedback
Generate profile feedback data

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate code-coverage from profile feedback and stop
OPTION.ODESC: Generate code-coverage from profile feedback and stop
Use profile feedback file(s)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File contains an RTS library function.
OPTION.ODESC: File contains an RTS library function.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File does not define any RTS library func (def.)
OPTION.ODESC: File does not define any RTS library func (def.)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File redefines an RTS library function.
OPTION.ODESC: File redefines an RTS library function.
Generate absolute listing file
Pre-define the assembly symbol NAME, optionally setting its contents to 'value'.
Generate assembly dependency information

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate first-level assembly include file list
OPTION.ODESC: Generate first-level assembly include file list
Generate listing file
Undefine assembly symbol NAME
Simulate source '.copy filename'
Generate cross reference file

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Do not require '#' on shift counts (mnem only)
OPTION.ODESC: Do not require '#' on shift counts (mnem only)
Simulate source '.include filename'

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Keep local symbols in output file
OPTION.ODESC: Keep local symbols in output file
Suppress all assembler warnings
Suppress identified assembler remark
Symbol names are not case-significant

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File is an assembly file (default for .asm)
OPTION.ODESC: File is an assembly file (default for .asm)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File is a C file (default for .c/no ext)
OPTION.ODESC: File is a C file (default for .c/no ext)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc)
OPTION.ODESC: File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File is an object file (default for .obj)
OPTION.ODESC: File is an object file (default for .obj)
Absolute listing directory (default is .obj dir)
Assembly file directory (default is .)
Listing/xref file directory (default is .obj dir)
Object file directory (default is .)
Temporary file directory (default is .)
Extension for assembly files (default is .asm)
Extension for C files (default is .c)

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Treat C files as C++ files
OPTION.ODESC: Treat C files as C++ files
Extension for C++ files (default is .cpp)
Extension for listing files (default is .lst)
Extension for object files (default is .obj)
Link using ROM autoinitialization model
Link using RAM autoinitialization model

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Produce an absolute, executable object file (default)
OPTION.ODESC: Produce an absolute, executable object file (default)
Set C argc/argv memory size

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Allow word mode code in byte mode executable
Don't use scn size in alloc ordering heuristics
OPTION.ODESC: Don't use scn size in alloc ordering heuristics
Pre-define preprocessor macro _name_ to _value_
Treat diagnostic <id> as error
Treat diagnostic <id> as remark
Suppress diagnostic <id>
Treat diagnostic <id> as warning
Disable automatic RTS selection
Disable conditional linking; ignore .clink directives

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Don't use C preprocessor for command files
OPTION.ODESC: This disables preprocessing of linker command files.
Emit diagnostic identifier numbers

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Specify the program entry point for the output module
OPTION.ODESC: Specify the program entry point for the output module

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Set default fill value for holes in output sections
OPTION.ODESC: Set default fill value for holes in output sections

OPTION.TOOLTIP: List dead functions removed by linker to file fname
OPTION.ODESC: Create a list of routines and sections that are dead (never referenced) in file fname. Default file name is dead_funcs.txt

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Exclude symbols matching pattern from localizeation
OPTION.ODESC: The option '--localize=l_pattern' makes the symbols matching the l_pattern hidden. The '--globalilze=g_pattern' option excludes symbols matchin g_pattern from symbol localization provided g_pattern is more restrictive than l_pattern.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Specify heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation
OPTION.ODESC: Specify heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation
Hide the symbols matching the pattern by changing the name to empty string

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Ignore alignment flags specified in input sections
OPTION.ODESC: Ignore alignment flags specified in input sections
Issue remarks

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Include library file or command file as input
OPTION.ODESC: Include library file or command file as input
Display usage information. Followed by another option, will display detailed information on that option.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Make the symbols matching pattern local
OPTION.ODESC: Given a symbol name pattern, make all the symbols matching this pattern local

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified
OPTION.ODESC: Don't make global symbol static if -h is specified
Make all global symbols static

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Produce listing of input and output sections in <file>
OPTION.ODESC: Produce listing of input and output sections in <file>

Enable the display of <attribute> or disable with no<attribute> in the linker generated map file. Multiple attributes can be specified by separating them with commas (e.g. --mapfile_contents=sections,nosymbols). Type --mapfile_contents=help for a list of attributes

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics
OPTION.ODESC: Don't demangle symbol names in diagnostics

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Disable type merging in symbolic debugging information
OPTION.ODESC: Disable type merging in symbolic debugging information

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Strip symbol table and line number entries
OPTION.ODESC: Strip symbol table and line number entries
Suppress warnings
Full filename of the output file.
Search libraries in priority order
Produce a relocatable output module
Reread libraries; resolve backward references
Produce absolute listing file

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Scan libraries for duplicate symbol definitions
OPTION.ODESC: Check whether symbol definitions that are pulled into the link are duplicated in any of the libraries included in the build. This information is typically ignored as the linker will pull in the first definition it encounters.
Alter the library-search algorithm to look in dir before looking in the default location. This option must appear before the -l option.
Set error limit to <count>
Set C system stack size
Strict compatibility checking

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Specify a symbol map, mapping refname to defname
OPTION.ODESC: Symbol mapping allows a symbol reference to be resolved by a symbol with different name. Symbol mapping allows functions to be overridden with alternate definitions. This feature can be used to patch in alternate implementations, which provide patches (bug fixes) or alternate functionality. For example, the option --symbol_map='foo=foo_patch' makes the linker resolve any references to foo by the definition foo_patch.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Specify size of output sysstack section
OPTION.ODESC: Specify size of output sysstack section

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol
OPTION.ODESC: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol
Undefine preprocessor macro _name_

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Exclude symbols matching pattern from symbol hinding
OPTION.ODESC: The option --hide=hide_pattern makes the symbols matching the hide_pattern hidden. The --unhide=unhide_pattern option excludes symbols matchin unhide_pattern from symbol hiding provided unhide_pattern is more restrictive than hide_pattern.
Verbose diagnostics

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Warn if an unspecified output section is created
OPTION.ODESC: Warn if an unspecified output section is created

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Produce detailed link information data-base in <file>
OPTION.ODESC: Produce detailed link information data-base in <file>
